goals__remit: The Federation of European Motorcyclists' Associations (FEMA) is the European federation of national road rider organisations. FEMA represents, defends and promotes motorcycling and the interests of million of powered two-wheeler users across Europe. Through its 22 national organisations from 17 countries, FEMA reaches 270,000 dedicated motorcyclists representing all social groups.
relevant_communication:
In 2015 FEMA organised the 3rd European Motorcyclists' Forum and published the Riderscan report. Periodical publications about for motorcyclists relevant developments in road safety, ITS, EU legislation etc. FEMA regularly publishes information about EU transport policy, EU road safety strategy, PPE,C-ITS, autonomous driving, urban mobility, EU and UN environment policy, EU energy policy, energy transition, driving licences, sound emissions and EU and UN technical demands regulation to inform stakeholders. FEMA also started campaigns to enhance motorcycle safety by better and safer road infrastructure and to reduce excessive noise by motorcycles. 
FEMA is active in communication through her website (www.fema-online.eu), Twitter (670 followers), Facebook (26,400 followers), Instagram and Google+.
